# Rendu TP5 - Code de Huffman

Le code est organisé en plusieurs parties :

```
main.cpp    - Le programme...
content.hpp - Contient les variables hard-codées (valeurs par défaut, etc.)
tree.hpp    - La structure d'arbre sur laquelle repose le programme (inclut
              un itérateur)
huffman.hpp - Les fonctions de génération d'encodeur et de décodage
```

## Codage de Huffmann

Pour la création de l'arbre et de la map pour la correspondance char -> code, voir dans `huffman.hpp`.

## Codage du texte

NB : Les valeurs présentes ont été générées à partir du dictionnaire fourni dans le TP.

- Texte donné encodé :

```

```

- Texte re-décodé :

```
o herlock olmes she is always  woman  have seldom heard him mention her under any other name n his eyes she eclipses and predominates the whole of her sex t was not that he felt any emotion akin to love for rene dler ll emotions and that one particularly were abhorrent to his cold precise but admirably balanced mind e was  take it the most perfect reasoning and observing machine that the world has seen but as a lover he would have placed himself in a false position e never spoke of the softer passions save with a gibe and a sneer hey were admirable things for the observerexcellent for drawing the veil from mens motives and actions ut for the trained reasoner to admit such intrusions into his own delicate and finely adjusted temperament was to introduce a distracting factor which might throw a doubt upon all his mental results rit in a sensitive instrument or a crack in one of his own highpower lenses would not be more disturbing than a strong emotion in a nature such as his nd yet there was but one woman to him and that woman was the late rene dler of dubious and questionable memory
```

Taille originale : 9168 bits
Taille encodé : 8330 bits
Taille re-décodé : 8792 bits

Taux de compression : 90.86%

## Expérience réelle

NB : Les valeurs suivantes ont été générées sans dictionnaire statique, le dictionnaire est généré au runtime.
